author: @LANACION
title: Manchester United venció por 3-1 a Southampton como local en la Premier League
text:
Manchester United venció por 3-1 a Southampton como local, en un partido de la jornada 21 de la Premier League. Para Manchester United los goles fueron marcados por Amad Diallo (a los 82, 90, 94 minutos). Para Southampton el gol fue marcado por Manuel Ugarte (en contra) (a los 43 minutos). En la próxima fecha, Manchester United se medirá con Brighton and Hove Albion, mientras que Southampton tendrá como rival a Nottingham Forest.
En los siguientes gráficos se pueden observar las formaciones de los equipos, los cambios, las principales incidencias del partido y la tabla de posiciones.
LA NACION
Encontrá resultados de fútbol en vivo, los próximos partidos, las tablas de posiciones, y todas las estadísticas de los principales torneos del mundo.

author: Daniele Sborzacchi
title: La Sir Volley Perugia vola ai quarti di Champions
text:
Una partita che vale la vetta matematica della Pool D e il passaggio del turno. Un percorso immacolato nella fase a gironi di Champions per la Sir Sicoma Monini Perugia che, con il netto 3-0 inflitto in trasferta al Ceske Budějovice, è certa ormai del passaggio ai quarti con una giornata di anticipo come “prima delle prime”. Un primo set vinto dai Block Devils ai vantaggi, con i padroni di casa che, spinti dal proprio pubblico partono a braccio sciolto, spingendo con aggressività anche nell’avvio del secondo parziale. Nel terzo set la battuta bianconera imprime però la sterzata decisiva (7 ace e 3 soli errori) a favore dei ragazzi di coach Angelo Lorenzetti che chiudono i conti con ampio margine (16-25).
I bianconeri archiviano il match nella repubblica ceca con un 55% di efficacia in attacco di squadra, 6 muri e 8 servizi vincenti. Capitan Giannelli manda in doppia cifra tutti i suoi attaccanti, a cominciare da Yuki Ishikawa, mvp della partita con 15 punti, un ace, il 65% in attacco e un block vincente, Semeniuk 12 punti a referto, Loser 10 ed Herrera 13. Come sempre in seconda linea Massimo Colaci è stato una garanzia di solidità in tutte le fasi del match.
JIHOSTROJ ČESKÉ BUDĚJOVICE – SIR SICOMA MONINI PERUGIA 0-3
(25-27, 22-25, 16-25)
JIHOSTROJ ČESKÉ BUDĚJOVICE: Emmer 2, Brichta 9, Rodriguez 8, Lestina 7, Parks 6, Sedlacek 8, Michalek (L), Nikpoor 1, Gonzalez, Pitner. N.E Okolic, Kovarick (L), Lubos, Knsko, Tomas (L). All. Smejkal.
SIR SICOMA MONINI PERUGIA: Giannelli 2, Herrera 13, Solè 4, Loser 10, Ishikawa 15, Semeniuk 12, Colaci (libero), Cianciotta, Ben Tara, Piccinelli. N.e: Candellaro, Zoppellari, All. Angelo Lorenzetti.
ARBITRI Stanislava Simic (Serbia) Pawel Burkiewicz
BUDĚJOVICE: b.s.14, ace 3, 42% ric. pos., 24% ric. prf., 27 % att., 55%, 5 muri.
PERUGIA: b.s.16, ace 8, 37% ric. pos., 26% ric. prf., 57% att., 4 muri.

author: jahannews.com
title: پیروزی سخت تیم اول والیبال جهان مقابل ایران
text:
تیم ملی والیبال کشورمان در آغاز هفته سوم لیگ ملتهای والیبال ۲۰۲۵ مقابل لهستان میزبان و تیم اول جهان نتیجه را واگذار کرد.
به گزارش جهان نیوز به نقل از فارس، در آغاز هفته سوم لیگ ملتهای والیبال ۲۰۲۵، تیم ملی کشورمان چهارشنبه از ساعت ۲۱:۳۰ در شهر گدانسک لهستان و در حضور حدود ۱۲ هزار تماشاگر به مصاف تیم قدرتمند میزبان رفت. شاگردان روبرتو پیاتزا در دیداری تماشایی و نفسگیر، عملکردی امیدوارکننده از خود به نمایش گذاشتند، اما در نهایت با نتیجه ۳ بر ۲ مغلوب لهستان، تیم اول رنکینگ جهان شدند. ملیپوشان ایران ستهای اول، سوم و پنجم را ۲۵ بر ۱۹، ۲۵ بر ۱۸ و ۱۵ بر ۸ به حریف واگذار کردند و در ستهای دوم و چهارم نمایش درخشانی داشتند و موفق به پیروزی ۲۵ بر ۲۳ و ۲۵ بر ۲۱ شدند. ایران با این نتیجه یک امتیاز را گرفت و لهستان هم ۲ امتیاز را کسب کرد. تیم ملی کشورمان فردا پنجشنبه (۲۶ تیر) در دومین مسابقه خود در این هفته، از ساعت ۱۸ بهوقت ایران به مصاف چین خواهد رفت.

author: Alex McCann
title: 135th Rose Parade boasts floral floats, sunny skies as California tradition kicks off new year
text: PASADENA, Calif. — Floral floats, marching bands and equestrian units took to the streets under a sunny California sky as the 135th Rose Parade drew hundreds of thousands of spectators on New Year’s Day. The Pasadena tradition on Monday featured Broadway legend Audra McDonald as grand marshal and the theme “Celebrating a World of Music: The Universal Language.” After recent rains and gray skies, there was plenty of sun for the 8 a.m. start of the spectacle with a military flyover of a B-2 stealth bomber. Among the fanciful floats was Kaiser Permanente’s colorful “Symphony of You,” which featured 8,000 roses and received the President Award for most outstanding use and presentation of flowers. The top prize, the 2024 Sweepstakes Trophy, went to the San Diego Zoo for the 55-foot float “It All Started With a Roar,” depicting its mascot Rex the Lion and celebrating wildlife conservation. The scheduled performers included Destiny’s Child singer Michelle Williams, “The Voice” winner Cassadee Pope and “American Idol” champion Jordin Sparks. Huge crowds lined the 5.5-mile parade route. Many camped out on sidewalks overnight, staking out their spots in the afternoon on New Year’s Eve. The parade was briefly interrupted by about 50 pro-Palestinian protesters carrying a banner demanding a cease-fire in the war between Israel and Hamas. They blocked the route before peacefully dispersing under police orders, said city spokesperson Lisa Derderian. McDonald later tossed the coin before the 110th Rose Bowl college football game between Alabama and Michigan. Success. Please wait for the page to reload. author: time news
title: With the onset of autumn, the number of cyber attacks in Estonia has increased significantly
text:
Cyber ​​attacks on ‍Estonian Internet users increased again in the fall, according ⁤to‌ statistics from Netivalvur, a service that protects against online‍ threats. The number of attacks, ‌which had been decreasing since‍ April, doubled in September, and in⁤ October ⁣exceeded 7⁤ million attacks ⁣per month, reports the Elisa press service.
“If in the‌ spring we ‌saw a long⁢ period ​of⁣ decline in ⁤figures, September was a painful reminder of the ‌importance of being vigilant on the Internet and‍ using cyber ​security ‍solutions to protect yourself and your loved ones,” Mailijs Ploommann , Elisa’s private leader. client section, comment on harvest​ statistics.
However, in September, this number rose to a record 4.5 million ​attacks, and in October it exceeded 7 ‍million. This ​is the‍ most attacks blocked in one⁤ month since the ​service⁣ was introduced two and ⁣a half years ago.
“In⁤ the‍ fall, when we move from the countryside to the city or when we ⁤return to school and work, surrounded by many electronics, we become an easier target ‌for scammers. This is confirmed by consumption​ statistics – as the use of⁤ the Internet on ‌different devices increases, so does the number of attacks,” said Ploommann.
One of the most common⁢ online fraud schemes among cybercriminals is to create sites that offer “free” entertainment. The ​most ‍common baits are online games and movies, and a new trend is comics that can be downloaded for free⁤ from infected sites. Such fake downloads often result in Trojans and other ⁣malware ​appearing on the user’s device‌ instead of the⁣ desired content.
“Unfortunately, people‍ always believe in mysterious opportunities⁢ to get virtual goods and services for free. It is time to part with such illusions, which often⁢ endanger the safety of our properties and savings. Criminals, ⁣no less than law-abiding citizens, ​follow different ‍trends, and instead of the desired service or product, the⁣ user often receives ⁢a malicious program that controls his device, ​copies his ‌data, or helps ⁣the fraudster to promote yet⁢ another scheme. There is no limit to the ingenuity of attackers,” said ​Ploommann.
The post⁣ With the ​beginning of autumn, the ‍number ‍of cyber attacks in Estonia has increased⁤ significantly appeared first on gazeta.ee.
What are⁤ the most common types⁢ of cyber attacks targeting⁣ individuals in ‍2023? Interview: Time.news Editor Meets Mailijs Ploommann, Cybersecurity Expert
Time.news⁢ Editor: Good afternoon, Mailijs. Thank you for joining us ​today to discuss the ⁢rising cyber threats facing Estonian Internet users. Could you start⁤ by explaining the recent spike in cyber attacks observed ⁤since September?
Mailijs ​Ploommann: Good ​afternoon! ⁤Yes, it’s a concerning trend. After a‍ period of declining numbers⁤ since‌ the spring, we saw a dramatic⁣ doubling‌ of cyber attacks in September. In October​ alone, the statistics exceeded 7 million attacks, which is alarming.
Time.news Editor: ‌ That’s staggering! What do ⁢you think​ contributed to this sudden increase?
Mailijs Ploommann: Several factors play‍ a role. Cybercriminals‌ often ramp⁢ up their activities in response to the ⁢changing digital​ landscape, such as⁤ increased online activity during the⁢ fall​ when people return to work or school. Additionally, we may have‍ seen ‍vulnerabilities exploited ‍that were previously overlooked. It’s a reminder⁣ that ⁣we can never let our guard down.
Time.news Editor: You ‍mentioned a decline in attacks earlier this year. Was ‌there⁣ anything specific that might have ⁣contributed to that downward trend?
Mailijs Ploommann: Absolutely. Organizations and individuals ‌alike had been ⁤more⁢ proactive about ​cybersecurity measures ⁣during that time, which likely deterred potential ⁤attacks. Awareness and education were⁢ critical. However,‍ as​ complacency can set‍ in after a “quiet” period, we saw a resurgence. It’s crucial ⁤to maintain vigilance.
Time.news Editor: With over 7 million ‌attacks reported in⁤ October, what steps can everyday users take to protect themselves? ⁢
Mailijs⁢ Ploommann: ‍There are several key practices everyone should‌ embrace. First, use robust, updated security⁤ software that can identify​ and neutralize threats before they reach your devices. Regularly ⁣changing ⁣passwords and using​ two-factor authentication adds an essential layer of protection. Lastly, being cautious with personal information online is vital.
Time.news⁤ Editor: ⁣How do you‍ see the role ‍of businesses in combating these attacks?‌
Mailijs Ploommann: Businesses play a‍ significant⁤ role in ⁢cyber defense. They need to invest in‍ the latest security infrastructure ⁤and educate their employees on recognizing⁢ potential ⁢threats. A comprehensive response plan ⁤is critical‍ for when‌ attacks⁣ occur, ensuring that they can minimize damage and maintain⁣ customer trust.
Time.news Editor: You mentioned the ‌importance of education. How can we improve public ​awareness surrounding these threats?
Mailijs Ploommann: Education⁤ is key! Initiatives like​ workshops, webinars, and ​easily accessible online resources can help people understand and recognize ⁤cyber threats. We also need to promote a culture ⁤of cybersecurity, ⁢where it’s​ seen as a shared responsibility, encouraging conversations‌ within families ‍and communities.
Time.news⁣ Editor: ⁣Certainly, creating a ⁢community-focused ⁢approach⁤ can make a difference. ​As an ‌expert ‍in this ​field, ‌what do you believe is the biggest misconception about cyber threats that people have?
Mailijs Ploommann: A common misconception is that cyber‍ attacks only happen to major‍ corporations or government entities. In‌ reality, individual ⁤users are ‍equally targeted. Cybercriminals‌ often⁤ prefer attacking​ smaller entities and private users because they frequently have‍ weaker ‌defenses. This highlights the‌ need for everyone to take cyber security seriously.
Time.news Editor: ​Those are‍ valuable insights! Looking ⁤ahead, ​what trends do you foresee in⁢ the cybersecurity landscape as we move into 2024?
Mailijs⁢ Ploommann: We​ can​ expect ⁢cybercriminals to‍ become even more sophisticated, utilizing‍ AI and machine learning to ⁢launch targeted attacks. It’s imperative that our defense mechanisms evolve in tandem. As ‍technology ‍advances, so must our methods of protection, staying⁤ one‌ step ahead of those who seek to exploit it.
Time.news⁤ Editor: Thank you, Mailijs, for sharing your expertise with us today! ⁢It’s a crucial topic, and ‌we⁣ appreciate all​ of your insights.‍
Mailijs Ploommann: Thank you for having me!⁤ I hope our discussion shines a light on ⁤the importance of cybersecurity for everyone.

author: @zazoomblog
title: Kimmich | Sono contento per Bisseck! Gioca in un top club
text:
Kimmich | Sono contento per Bisseck! Gioca in un top club
Yann Aurel Bisseck all’età di 24 anni ha ottenuto la sua prima convocazione con la maglia della Germania. Joshua Kimmich, su Sportschau, ha elogiato il percorso del difensore. DIFFICOLTÀ – La carriera di Yann Aurel Bisseck è qualcosa di difficilmente replicabile. Il difensore sembrava non poter rispettare le aspettative che c’erano su di lui, poi si è rialzato e ora Gioca all’Inter come uno dei co-titolari della rosa di Simone Inzaghi. Prima niente è stato facile però, a partire dall’esordio tra i professionisti. Bisseck è sceso in campo con i grandi per la prima volta a 16 anni e ciò ha creato intorno al Giocatore pressioni indicibili. Negli anni successivi Bisseck ha lasciato la Germania. È passato dal Portogallo, poi dalla Danimarca con l’Aarhus.ùBisseck, arriva l’investitura di Kimmich!CRESCITA – Il duro lavoro e la fiducia hanno portato Bisseck a tornare nel calcio dei grandi.Leggi su Inter-news.it
Inter-news.it - Kimmich: «Sono contento per Bisseck! Gioca in un top club»
- Kimmich: “Felice per Bisseck. Abbiamo parlato della Champions. In un top club come l’Inter…”
- Inter-Bayern, Rummenigge: "Calhanoglu? Solo speculazioni, interessava Thuram e seguo Bisseck"
- Kimmich: "Sono felice per Bisseck, abbiamo parlato anche un po' della Champions..."
- Kimmich su Bisseck: "Gioca bene in un top club. E parliamo di Inter-Bayern..."
- Kimmich: Felice per Bisseck. Abbiamo parlato della Champions. In un...
- Bisseck: Concorrenza? Con Nagelsmann ogni partita conta. Kimmich: Yann è qui senza aver seguito la strada…
Ne parlano su altre fonti
- Kimmich: “Felice per Bisseck. Abbiamo parlato della Champions. In un top club come l’Inter…” - Il capitano della Germania, Joshua Kimmich, ha parlato della prima convocazione nella nazionale maggiore per Bisseck ... (fcinter1908.it)
- Kimmich: "Felice per Bisseck. Abbiamo parlato della Champions. In un..." - Sui tifosi tedeschi "Abbiamo un dato molto positivo, siamo contenti. Penso che siano contenti di come sta giocando la nazionale, le partite destano sempre grande interesse e speriamo di fare felici ta ... (informazione.it)
- Bisseck: "Concorrenza? Con Nagelsmann ogni partita conta". Kimmich: "Yann è qui senza aver seguito la strada tradizionale" - 'Quando entri a San Siro, senti un po' di storia'. Usa un eufemismo Yann Bisseck per descrivere, ai microfoni di Sportschau, ciò che si prova quando si varcano le porte della Scala del Calcio, stadio ... (informazione.it)

author: SNS
title: Centre considering subsidy to farmers for adopting natural farming - The Statesman
text:
Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chauhan, on Friday, emphasised the need to promote natural farming practices. He said that the Central government was considering offering subsidies to encourage natural farming methods.
Speaking at the ‘Bhartiya Prakritik Krishi Paddhati’ programme here, he highlighted that the consequences of using chemicals and fertilizers to boost agricultural production are evident. He said while the world is increasingly concerned about global warming and climate change, we ourselves are largely to blame.
If urgent measures are not taken, the Earth could become uninhabitable for future generations, he warned.
The Union agriculture minister said India embodies the principle “Sarve Bhavantu Sukhinah, Sarve Santu Niramaya” (everyone should be happy and healthy). This principle was also reflected in ancient farming practices, which did not rely on chemical fertilizers. At that time, the soil was fertile, and nutritious food was produced. However, as the demand increased, so did the use of chemical fertilizers, leading to higher production but also more diseases and the need for special trains like the Cancer Express.
Chauhan noted that people are now more concerned about their health than ever before and are willing to pay a premium for produce grown without chemicals.
Dismissing the misconception that natural farming would reduce production, he assured that it wouldn’t affect production levels or storage.
He praised the farmers who are successfully growing crops without chemicals and emphasized that the use of pesticides harms soil fertility and disrupts beneficial insects, contributing to global disasters and threatening human existence. To safeguard the Earth’s future, he stressed the importance of promoting natural farming practices.
The minister reiterated the Central government’s commitment to promoting natural farming to sustain the Earth. While providing subsidies to farmers practicing natural farming, the government will establish a certification system for them. Additionally, the government plans to compensate farmers for up to three years by depositing funds into their accounts.
He highlighted that production without chemicals can also enhance taste, and the government is dedicated to this goal. Continuous efforts are being made in this direction, with scientists working on increasing production without chemicals.
The event was attended by Gujarat Governor Acharya Devvrat, UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, and UP Agriculture Minister Surya Pratap Shahi, among others.
